newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Avantel to offer int'l flat-rate charges.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Avantel to offer int'l flat-rate charges.

text.p: Avantel, a newcomer to Mexico's recently demonopolized long-distance market, said on Thursday it had introduced flat-rate charges for U.S. calls.
This is the first time flat-rate charges for international calls have been applied in Mexico, Avantel said.
Avantel said in a statement it will charge 1.59 pesos per minute for calls to U.S. cities near the border with Mexico, and 3.99 pesos per minute in calls to all other areas in the United States.

The telephone company also said it trimmed flat-rate charges for domestic long-distance calls to 1.29 pesos per minute, down from the 1.30 pesos recently matched by former telephone monopoly Telefonos de Mexico (Telmex).
Avantel is a joint venture between Mexican Grupo Financiero Banamex Accival SA de CV, or Banacci and U.S. MCI Communications Corp.
Formerly state-owned Telmex enjoyed a monopoly over long-distance calls in Mexico until Jan. 1.
